legacy.full_text:
🧵
#BRICS adds 6 new members, namely #Argentina, #Egypt, #Ethiopia, #Iran, #SaudiArabia and the #UAE. Here are 3 reasons why the 6 were chosen, according to Wang Youming, an expert with the CIIS. #BRICSSummit2023

legacy.description: Information and insight on everything related to China's interaction with the world
legacy.name: Beijing Channel

legacy.full_text:
2. All 6 countries have sizable economies. Measured by total GDP, GDP growth, and GDP per capita, the 6 countries are on par with existing BRICS members.
3. All 6 countries wield considerable geopolitical sway.

legacy.description: Information and insight on everything related to China's interaction with the world
legacy.name: Beijing Channel

legacy.full_text: Wang says there have been differences on whether to expand BRICS, with some saying a smaller bloc would ensure efficiency, while others say a bigger group would be more effective in speaking up for developing countries. In the end, the latter argument proved more persuasive. End

value.string_value: The arrangement dates back to 2007 and the development is a Chinese domestic de-regulation. The likelihood of Russia ceding Vladivostok to China is zero.
Did Russia just "bow to Beijing" in "opening" Vladivostok?

legacy.full_text:
As early as 2007, China greenlit Vladivostok as a transit point for Chinese domestic trade - an internal regulatory move by Beijing, NOT Moscow. 
So no, there is no breakthrough. And it's not going to work wonders.
https://t.co/JewpGnPKGO

The latest @pekingnology newsletter explained more in detail the point I had made earlier, that the development around Vladivostok (Haishenwai) is not geopolitical but rather commercial-driven. https://t.co/UFdUmXVe7n

legacy.description: Information and insight on everything related to China's interaction with the world
legacy.name: Beijing Channel

legacy.full_text:
🧵
Many hail #Didi & #Meituan, icons of #China’s gig economy, as employers that gave more equal footing for male and female employees. But a study shows that their seemingly gender-blind algorithm effectively penalizes female drivers.

legacy.description: Information and insight on everything related to China's interaction with the world
legacy.name: Beijing Channel

legacy.full_text: Furthermore, many female gig workers complain of toxic working environments dominated by men. Some say their worker WeChat groups are often filled with inappropriate messages that are offensive to women. In response, some female gig workers formed their own WeChat groups. /8

legacy.description: Information and insight on everything related to China's interaction with the world
legacy.name: Beijing Channel

legacy.full_text:
To be clear, the report isn’t to chastise these internet companies but rather to show that its algorithm has room to improve in promoting gender equality, especially when these companies play such a big role in China’s gig economy.
Read more: https://t.co/cuj6onoreY End
